trans-unit.source: .NET Core Library Samples
trans-unit.target: .NET Core Library Samples

trans-unit.source: **Note:** This document is compatible with tooling that is still in active development.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** This document is compatible with tooling that is still in active development.

trans-unit.source: Details are subject to change over time.
trans-unit.target: Details are subject to change over time.

trans-unit.source: These samples are buildable projects whose source is used for code snippets in [the guide for writing cross-platform libraries](../../../docs/core/tutorials/libraries.md).
trans-unit.target: These samples are buildable projects whose source is used for code snippets in [the guide for writing cross-platform libraries](../../../docs/core/tutorials/libraries.md).

trans-unit.source: They can be built and run using the .NET Core RC1 toolchain, and are intended to simply demonstrate how to target and build NuGet packages for different targets.
trans-unit.target: They can be built and run using the .NET Core RC1 toolchain, and are intended to simply demonstrate how to target and build NuGet packages for different targets.

trans-unit.source: They aren't examples of how you'd build a real, feature-complete library.
trans-unit.target: They aren't examples of how you'd build a real, feature-complete library.

trans-unit.source: To build/use any of these (using `new-library` as an example):
trans-unit.target: To build/use any of these (using `new-library` as an example):

trans-unit.source: Open your favorite Command Line Interface (e.g. Cmd.exe or Terminal).
trans-unit.target: Open your favorite Command Line Interface (e.g. Cmd.exe or Terminal).

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the top-level directory:
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the top-level directory:

trans-unit.source: Restore packages by typing the following:
trans-unit.target: Restore packages by typing the following:

trans-unit.source: To build and package the library as a NuGet package, type the following:
trans-unit.target: To build and package the library as a NuGet package, type the following:

trans-unit.source: Check out the `/bin/Debug` directory to see the generated artifacts and `.nupkg`.
trans-unit.target: Check out the `/bin/Debug` directory to see the generated artifacts and `.nupkg`.

trans-unit.source: To run unit tests (only applicable to `new-library`):
trans-unit.target: To run unit tests (only applicable to `new-library`):

trans-unit.source: And that's it!
trans-unit.target: And that's it!

trans-unit.source: new-library
trans-unit.target: new-library

trans-unit.source: The project under `/new-library` is a project targeting **only** .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: The project under `/new-library` is a project targeting **only** .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: It demonstrates two other things: how to use multiple projects and how to test.
trans-unit.target: It demonstrates two other things: how to use multiple projects and how to test.

trans-unit.source: There are two libraries showcased.
trans-unit.target: There are two libraries showcased.

trans-unit.source: The first, `DependencyLibrary`, contains functionality that the second, `Library` uses.
trans-unit.target: The first, `DependencyLibrary`, contains functionality that the second, `Library` uses.

trans-unit.source: The `LibraryTests` test project takes a dependency on `Library` to test that project.
trans-unit.target: The `LibraryTests` test project takes a dependency on `Library` to test that project.

trans-unit.source: frameworks-library
trans-unit.target: frameworks-library

trans-unit.source: **IMPORTANT:** This project requires Windows and .NET Framework installed on your machine.
trans-unit.target: **IMPORTANT:** This project requires Windows and .NET Framework installed on your machine.

trans-unit.source: The project under `/frameworks-library` demonstrates a project for targeting .NET Framework that you can build and run with the CLI tools.
trans-unit.target: The project under `/frameworks-library` demonstrates a project for targeting .NET Framework that you can build and run with the CLI tools.

trans-unit.source: It does so with a simple project targeting .NET Framework 4.0.
trans-unit.target: It does so with a simple project targeting .NET Framework 4.0.

trans-unit.source: You could extend this to target additional version so of .NET Framework by adding new build targets in the `project.json`.
trans-unit.target: You could extend this to target additional version so of .NET Framework by adding new build targets in the `project.json`.

trans-unit.source: Check out the [section on cross-compiling](../../../docs/core/tutorials/libraries.md#how-to-multitarget) in the CLI libraries article for more information.
trans-unit.target: Check out the [section on cross-compiling](../../../docs/core/tutorials/libraries.md#how-to-multitarget) in the CLI libraries article for more information.

trans-unit.source: net45-compat-library
trans-unit.target: net45-compat-library

trans-unit.source: **IMPORTANT:** This project requires Windows and .NET Framework installed on your machine.
trans-unit.target: **IMPORTANT:** This project requires Windows and .NET Framework installed on your machine.

trans-unit.source: The project under `/net45-compat-library` is for targeting any of the following:
trans-unit.target: The project under `/net45-compat-library` is for targeting any of the following:

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework 4.5 and above
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework 4.5 and above

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1

trans-unit.source: Whindows Phone Silverlight 8
trans-unit.target: Whindows Phone Silverlight 8

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform

trans-unit.source: DNX Core
trans-unit.target: DNX Core

trans-unit.source: Xamarin
trans-unit.target: Xamarin

trans-unit.source: Mono
trans-unit.target: Mono

trans-unit.source: It uses the `dotnet51` Target Framework Moniker introduced with the .NET Platform Standard.
trans-unit.target: It uses the `dotnet51` Target Framework Moniker introduced with the .NET Platform Standard.

trans-unit.source: net40-library
trans-unit.target: net40-library

trans-unit.source: **IMPORTANT:** This project requires Windows and .NET Framework installed on your machine.
trans-unit.target: **IMPORTANT:** This project requires Windows and .NET Framework installed on your machine.

trans-unit.source: The project under `/net40-library` is for how to target .NET Framework 4.0 and above.
trans-unit.target: The project under `/net40-library` is for how to target .NET Framework 4.0 and above.

trans-unit.source: It also demonstrates how to use `#if` directives to multi-target for a .NET 4.0 target.
trans-unit.target: It also demonstrates how to use `#if` directives to multi-target for a .NET 4.0 target.

trans-unit.source: pcl-library
trans-unit.target: pcl-library

trans-unit.source: **IMPORTANT:** This project requires Windows and .NET Framework installed on your machine.
trans-unit.target: **IMPORTANT:** This project requires Windows and .NET Framework installed on your machine.

trans-unit.source: The project under `/pcl-library` is for showing how to target a supported PCL Profile (e.g. 3344).
trans-unit.target: The project under `/pcl-library` is for showing how to target a supported PCL Profile (e.g. 3344).

trans-unit.source: It shows how to structure the `project.json` file to allow for targeting a PCL.
trans-unit.target: It shows how to structure the `project.json` file to allow for targeting a PCL.

trans-unit.source: It also demonstrates how to use `#if` directives and how to set those up in conjunction with the `project.json` file.
trans-unit.target: It also demonstrates how to use `#if` directives and how to set those up in conjunction with the `project.json` file.
